shapes

Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Counter

  • public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
    Displays numerical values, such as score or lives remaining. Counters are displayed in the upper-left corner of the game window. They have a name and value, both of which are displayed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Counter(java.lang.String name, int initialValue)
      Construct a new counter with a given name and value.

      • increaseBy

        Parameters:

      • decreaseBy

        public void decreaseBy(int amount)
        Decrease this counter's value by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount by which to decrease this counter's value.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this counter so it will be removed from the game. Call this method only when you have finished using the counter.

        A destroyed counter will not appear on the screen. A destroyed counter cannot be undestroyed.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets this counter's name.
        Parameters:
        name - this counter's new name.

        Set this counter's numerical value.

        Returns this counter's numerical value.
        Returns:
        this counter's numerical value.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Return whether this counter has been destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if this counter has been destroyed, false if not.
